title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held with a group. There were around 7–8 people on the panel, and everyone was very kind and generous. They introduced themselves first and asked each of us to introduce ourselves and started with questions related to cultural competency and when we went above and beyond, and so on
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was good! and afterwards I got to go on a tour of the unit. They were very informative and allowed plenty of time for all of my questions. Manager was outgoing my and made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Ok, easy questions and was only about 30 minutes long nothing major. The schedule wasn't the best that's why j didn't take it. Would want something different with better benefits.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: Pharmacy Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: it was ok. They interviewed through the phone but there seems to be a schedule problem thats why they were hesitant to hire me. The process was fast and they didn't get back to me since my schedule is not that flexible
Interview Questions: What days are you available to work?

title: Office Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very easy in the process. done within two weeks.  got a call then a in-person interview within two weeks.  orientation was a easy process and all questions where answered by human resources in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute to our team

title: Student Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: A combination of a group interview and personal interview. The more important one is the personal interview in which you’ll be asked a few basis questions about your experience and then a personal question about yourself.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your free time?

title: FNS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Really simple and easy. I got hired on the spot. You just have to be yourself. Lots of questions that just require common sense answers, if I’m not mistaken I believe I received a packet to read and was tested on it that same day.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself doing 5-10 years from now

title: Clinical Nurse I (New Grad) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied mid-June, I was set to take my nclex first week of July and had my interview about mid-July. The interview was a  panel of 7 managers plus the recruiter. They all introduced themselves and they asked me my top 3 choices of units. I brought a portfolio with me and most of their questions came out of that. Definitely ask a lot of questions and know about PVHMC when you go for your interview.  I was offered a position after a week and a half.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Pomona Valley?

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Questions were quit common, it was a good interview. I asked for a certain amount, they said that was in the budget. They did offer my the job but with 3 dollars less. I didn't take it.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Cerner?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two Interviews with team and vice president, asked questions about the position and what you know about the hospital. Very quick process since the team was very responsive. Both in-person interviews.
Interview Questions: What  are you looking for in this position?

title: STEP Force Junior Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Simple and fast. The interviewer was very nice and approachable and made the whole scenario less stressful than I anticipated. Overall a good experience. It is nothing to be afraid of, but do prepare to answer the questions to the best of your ability.
Interview Questions: What was the last movie that made you cry?

title: Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: First, you get tested for basic math and English skills. After that, casual interview appointment with a supervisor. Just your typical one-on-one interview. It takes a while to finally start since you have to get medical clearance, pass a background check, etc,  but that comes with any hospital job. Training is paid and is stretched out to 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with different health insurance plans and running their eligibility?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Late night interview at the hospital.  Appointment was scheduled a week later, each appointment was scheduled every 15 minutes from other candidates.  Panel of 3, including supervisor.  Friendly, comfortable atmosphere.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse LDRP Post Partum (New Grad) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call a few days later for a next day late night interview with the three night shift nursing supervisors (all VERY nice). The interview took place in the supervisor's office, it was comfortable and informal. Average length, they described the position and asked a few questions - "tell me about yourself"
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time in clinical where you did something you were proud of, or a time where you made a mistake that you learned from

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (New York, NY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was great but the meeting with HR was horrible.  They aren't much help at all or at least the person I was dealing with at the time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: ICU Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to a hiring event, went to panel interview, then interviewed with manager of unit then the director. The whole process took a couple of weeks but that was only because the manager was on vacation at one point during the process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Shift Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with a total of 2 visits with department heads. The return interview was with the department manager. A last phone call with the department manager will confirm offer and hire process to move forward into background checking.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied in person and was interviewed at the hospital by the unit manager and charge nurse. I was asked about what shifts I could work and how often (applied for per diem position). After interview, the manager showed me around the unit, and I was introduced to a few staff members. It took about an hour altogether.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict between you and a co-worker and how you handled it.

title: Admitting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: they asked why you wanna work there, describe yourself, has clerical exam and typing test, supervisor was very casual and the exam area is at the hr, pretty much it is a good experience
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Junior Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Once you have submitted your application and everything, the interview is suppose to take place in a group setting-with yourself and two interviewees and three other students. But for me, something happened and the other students didn't show up so I had to do it alone. Luckily, it was a fun one...
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer at PVHMC?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I am a former employee of this institution and was hired by the past director of the E.D. back in 2006. Was very satisfied until the new management completely took over and basically did what they wanted to do. That former director was disliked by many of the registered nurses but she did more for the good of the E.D. for all her employees because she stepped up to back up her employees and the E.D. She was more real with the application of social and analytical skills, instead of just hiring and/or keeping "good" employees.
Interview Questions: None because she realized that the formalities aren't as important in the hiring process. That's what the application or resume is for. She asked questions or the conversation during the interview was based more on who and what the potential employee really is because she knew that would result in a better employee.

title: ER SCRIBE Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Relaxed
asked questions about my experience working with patients
Very nice and polite
not intimidating whatsoever
Staff seemed nice 
Gave a detailed description of what i would do
The interview was quite short and lasted only 20 minutes and it was with the lead scribe and doctor. They were very nice and polite
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple things?

title: Human Resources Analyst/Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Received a call from hiring manager, she screened me and mentioned there was another opportunity in the same field and would I like to apply for that too? I thought that is very kind.

Was a 3 person panel interview.

Head of HR department  spoke in a derogatory manner. After 5 minutes I knew it was a huge waste of time.
Interview Questions: Asked why I wanted to work there? Quizzed on do I know who the hospital is?

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Pomona Valley Hospital Medical Center (Pomona, CA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is painless and thorough giving the applicant a sense of feeling welcomed. The HR staff is friendly and highly competent. Together with the education department, the hospital ensures that an applicant has met and fulfilled any necessary requirements for the job. You are made to feel like part of the team immediately upon being hired and support remains consistent as part of the hospital infrastructure
Interview Questions: Why the interest in PVHMC and why an interest to work there.
